page.title: 05FARMS IN GENERAL
page.content: { Farms}around{Ponteland}are mainly livestock with one or two pig farms,some dairy and some sucklers.But the main ones are for{breeding beef.An average calf costs about{Â£450 and an average lamb{Â£35.Spring}is a very busy time for the farmer.This is when the lambing begins.Dipping the sheep is done in about July to prevent {ticks}and{lice.Summer}is when the sheep are clipped and their wool is sold.After shearing there is the silage and hay to be cut and stored for food for the cattle in the winter.After that the farmers plough their fields and sow the seeds.Winter is when the farmers do all their repair jobs and get ready for lambing.All in all it is a very busy year for a farmer.
